review_data.review_title: A lovely spot to while away the time, even if not for afternoon tea
review_data.review: While staying at the hotel recently, we were looking for lunch and decided to have a quick bite at the Park Room. We had only experienced them for afternoon tea before, so perusing their "all day dining" menu was a little different.  They have a good selection of salads and sandwiches, which can be augmented with a good selection of wines and champagnes.  Food is a subset of that on offer from the JW Steakhouse (also in the hotel), but served in the opulent style of the Park Room.  If you're looking for something slightly less than afternoon tea, this is an option. (Although afternoon tea at the Park Room is also excellent.)

review_data.review: Good parilla, great price and super service! Definitely highly recommended, especially if you are able to eat a lot :D

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: We ate here on our first night in Marrakech, the restaurant was very busy but we managed to get a table. The staff were very friendly & the food was very tasty. Just off the main square & easy to find. We have been back again as the food was one of the best meals we ate whilst in Marrakech & ordered different dishes which were equally delicious. If you are in Marrakech you should definitely visit!

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: We visited here after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor. The restaurant was busy but we managed to get a seat on the terrace. The staff were very friendly. We were quite disappointed with the food which arrived quickly. The chicken pastille wasn’t as tasty or fresh as the ones we have eaten elsewhere at other restaurants. The chicken shawarma was also tasteless & dry. The previous reviews did not match our experience.

review_data.review_title: A must go if you are staying in the Hotel
review_data.review: It was late when we checked into the Hotel so we decided to roam around the hotel and find food. We came to this Sea.Fire.Salt Seafood restaurant and decided we just eat here, that was the best decision the day.  We were impressed with how elaborated the Salt can be with every dish during our dinner. The staff appeared to know their Salts very well too. The recommended type of Salt for us tasted just great with our food.  We had a table indoor because it was raining. Ambiance was great. Food was great.  Service was prompt and attentive.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review_title: Very nice Thai food within the hotel
review_data.review: We were staying at the Anantara Layan Phuket Resort and was highly recommended this Thai fine dining restaurant by the hotel staff. Was a buggy ride away from the hotel room.  The view from the restaurant was great. Good before the sunset so that you can enjoy both the sunset and the night view.  Alfresco dining is recommended because you will have the unblocked view to the sea and the pool. But get ready your insect repellent and embrace the heat because the fans weren't helping much.  We ordered a set menu for 2 pax. Was decent but nothing exceptional. The pace of serving was a little too lengthy, we actually got bored waiting for food after a while. We got seated by 6 pm and we left the restaurant at 8.30 pm.  Would I recommend this to anyone? If you are staying at the resort, why not because you don't have much choices there.  If you are making a trip here from elsewhere, I don't think you miss much.

Seafront views, fancy ingredients and very good service. This is a place for a special meal.  Portion sizes were, for us, quite big, and we couldn't finish everything we ordered. Staff were fantastic throughout.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: I came here with my husband for his birthday dinner as he was really excited to try the asado. I am a vegetarian and came here knowing it would not be as exciting for me as him. However, I was a bit disappointed in what I got. My main course was a risotto, which I found strange. Why not grilled vegetables instead? I would have loved to have something grilled as well. My husband said his steak was just ok and not as good as he thought, he came with very high expectations. That being said, our host was fantastic and very knowledgable! He went out of his way to make sure everyone was having a good time and well taken care of. We also enjoyed getting to talk to people in the family style sitting at dinner. We sat next to a lovely couple. Would recommend for those wanting an asado experience.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: I had bought a three course lunch here as part of a Virgin Experience Voucher for my mum's Christmas present, and wanted to give a 5-star review as it was a really fabulous afternoon. The service was thoughtful and attentive and Francesco was a lovely waiter. I loved the special touches to the experience- the complimentary bread and butter, mini tacos and fudge were all delicious and an unexpectedly kind touch which I didn't expect given that we were paying with a voucher. Plus these extras helped to keep me full for the whole day! The chequerboard menu was fun and I was delighted with my food (as was my mother). I'd really recommend the celeriac starter - a delicious salty sweetness to it. And the carrot cake was soo good. Beautifully presented food and the perfect portion size for a lunch. I have eaten in quite a few 'fine dining' restaurants and Launceston Place stood out for me as an absolutely wonderful experience and excellent food. Plus, my mum, who has never eaten out somewhere like this, had her mind blown by it haha. We will be back!

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: Bon et merci,  We had a very nice meal with our son who is working on an assignment in Siem Reap. This was high on his list to take us to. Great tasting Spring Rolls but there were also subtle variations on a popular theme to provide a good meal choice. Two portions of different rolls each plus a bowl of hummus provided a very good meal. Nice rose wine according to my wife was much appreciated after a busy day site seeing. It seems the hosts were the owners and made an effort to ensure all were having a good experience. Last orders 9,30 pm and it is advisable to book.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: Our hotel did not serve breakfast so finding this cafe so close was gold. All meals are so cheap, cooked to perfection and you can make it breakfast, lunch and dinner. In fact when we went for dinner we got the last available table and several people lined up waiting for a table. If its near your hotel look for it. We had 2 breakfasts, 2 lunches and 1 dinner here.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: Located on the top floor of the Intercontinental Hotel, the restaurant has a wonderful view over the sprawling city of istanbul. The service is attentive but not obtrusive, timely but not rushed. The menu is predominantly traditional Turkish fayre - I had the fish soup and lamp kebab which was served on a bed of rice with steamed spinach. The food was well presented and full of flavour with adequate portion size. With a bottle of water and service it came to just over £30 which I felt was good value.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: This review is for my second return visit in January but TripAdvisor does not allow subsequent reviews until at least a month has passed which is a shame as I wanted this to go live immediatlely after our visit.  Background: although our previous visit was marred by a menu/billing mix up the food was clearly very good so I wanted to return to experience it to the full and with that in mind I contacted the restaurant to give them my direct feedback. Pawel acknowledged my complaint and was genuinely apologetic and confirmed that he would make amends on our next visit. As it happens I'm not in London that frequently but circumstances necessitated that I was there a few weeks later and therefore made a much anticipated booking.  In a nutshell, it was a top notch experience -Katie our waitress looked after us like we were VIP guests and it was nice to meet Pawel who gave us a warm welcome and also saw us to our table and last but not least Vanessa the Manageress who came over to say "hello". Vanessa was very personable and it was really enjoyable to chat with her.  The whole meal was excellent, my favourite is the slow cooked beef ragu in Chianti -a must try dish!  Sadly I have no immediate plans to return to London but Theo Randall will be on my to do list when I am next in town.....

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: I travelled to London from little village oooop nooorf called Manchester to attend a reunion in Mayfair and took the opportunity to meet up with my daughter who is currently living in London for dinner so wanted a quality restaurant but nothing stuffy.  I was checking out various venues and as it was going to be an early evening meeting I spotted that there was an excellent set menu offering at Theos so I immediately made an online booking to secure a table as it was for a Saturday -success, however, heads up, there's a booking system glitch!  On the evening there was confusion with the staff regarding the menu, initially we were given a la carte menus despite the booking stating it was for the set menu.  In the end is was sorted, to a degree, as we were presented with a set menu option, but, not the one I had booked which included half a bottle of wine per person, apparently that one was not recognised and ours only included a glass of prosecco each! I decided not to make a fuss but clearly I was not happy especially for this mix up to happen in such a reputable hotel/restaurant*  Upon returning home I contacted the restaurant and Pawel was very apologetic and acknowledged that there was a glitch on the booking system and that he would make amends for our next visit......  Anyway, back to to the food -it was all very good and the staff were attentive but needless to say the experience was tempered due to the menu saga along with having to pay an extra £40 (unnecessarily) for wine so I shall reserve final judgement and do a more detailed report when we have our return visit.  *I first frequented the London Intercon about 40 years ago.

review_data.review_title: Great Italian/Thai pizza place & superb coffee
review_data.review: We visit Ciao nearly daily while staying in Hilton. Pizzas, Pastas and Sea-bass are great, our kid loves crab meat soup, taco and lamb chops. Also they have great home made lemonades and smoothes. Thanks a lot to ms Bell and all the rest team for a great service. We will definitely come back - tomorrow for lunch. Please keep 2 coconuts for us :-) as we miss them if you don’t have them.

review_data.review_title: Delicious tasting menu – rest is average
review_data.review: We came here because of the good reviews. We ordered the tasting menu but exchanged the mains and the deserts. Which was a mistake. The first courses of the tasting menu were fantastic, delicious and nicely presented. We loved the scallops and the carpaccio was absolutely delicious. Very disappointing were the mains. We exchanged the lamb to seabass and beef lok lak. Both were not really good and not nicely presented. We had the feeling we got food from a different restaurant. The desserts were o.k, but just too big. They had a great service and great drinks. Overall the tasting menu was really nice and absolutely recommendable. But you should stick to this if you are a real foodie.

review_data.review: Its grilled chicken Khmer style with mashed sweet potato goes down as one of my top 10 meals. Its owner, one of Cambodia’s top chefs, tries to promote real countryside cuisine based on recipes which have been passed down through generations. The result is a creative display of interesting stuff and a delicious feast of flavours. It gets extremely busy at night so I preferred lunches. Prices are very reasonable. Not to be missed. Try some of the very creative cocktails created using tradicional Cambodian stuff like local Whisky and palm sugar.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: This is a unique restaurant for its truly outstanding food and the chef behind it all, a national celebrity who trains aspiring chef. He himself was trained in Siem Reap and uses his grandmother’s recipes to create delicious dishes based on tradicional Cambodian food fused with South East Asian stuff. A absolutely adore the grilled chicken with the sweet potato and coconut milk mash, and the grilled rice balls/dumplings with chive. There are a lot of dishes for the more adventurous palate also, using local herbs and roots. All very very delicious indeed and very reasonably priced. On this trip to Siem Reap I visited 4 times in one week.

One of my best meals ever and a wonderful discovery. Food is reasonably priced, and very very good. I would say Michelin-star quality: very innovative, wonderfully presented and just extremely tasty. I loved the spicy chicken wings in a delicious curry sauce and the Cambodian grilled chicken served with a fabulous sweet potato and coconut mash. Shall return tomorrow. The chef is well known in the local circle and is highly regarded. Is something who will be around for a long time creating wonderful dishes.

review_data.review_title: Very nice and cosmopolitan steak and seafood grill
review_data.review: This is a great variation of your seafood and steak grill with a great variety of world starters and an extensive menu for seafood and steak. Nice choice is you like either

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: An amazing value for money menu with great food and extraordinary Teppanyaki chefs.a culinary experience at very reasonable price. Highly recommended

We had the single best bite of our trip in Paris here. It was a venison "hunter's pie" served as part of a venison two-ways main course. The other part was the most perfectly cooked piece of venison I have ever had, but the pie was life changing. I had never had venison served in a shredded bbq-esque presentation before, nor had I have had mashed potatoes with white chocolate. Now I wonder how I could have missed out on such a genius combination for so long. I will never see mashed potatoes the same way again.  Like the Park Hyatt hotel itself, where I stayed, there's really nothing to fault about my meal here. If anything, the amuse were just fine (but interesting and creative), and then the meal just kept building strength upon strength. The desserts were astoundingly good. The only negative I can think of is that I had way too much food (and wine), and almost fell asleep. But then the pre-dessert refresher did it's job at waking me up for the actual desserts that pushed our meal past midnight.  Many reviewers suggest another star will be awarded to Pur' in time, and it's not hard to see why. It really felt like a 1-star restaurant cooking above its level, and therefore it was almost a relative bargain, if you can call a E200pp+ meal that. And if you're staying at the Park Hyatt already, it is also crazy convenient to stumble back into bed!

The foods are very fresh and delicious. You must wait very long time to be served. They don't accept credit card so we felt a little bit disappointed.

review_data.review: First of all if you want to eat in the evening here you are advised to book as it is a very popular place. The three course set dinner menu is superb, tasty, good portion size and best of all an excellent price. The service is spot on friendly and welcoming, quick and attentive with great background music, this is one of the best of its kind in Marrakech and well worth visiting.

We went to this restaurant because of the amazing reviews and we were glad we did. The reviews don’t lie! The staff was very friendly from beginning to end, we felt very welcomed immediately. We had a reservation and the table was ready when we arrived. The food was fantastic. I ordered the salmon and was amazing. My husband ordered the steak and he said it was ok, a little under done, even though he asked medium well. I guess that’s the way the cook in Paris. But the real champion of the evening was the dessert. We shared a Creme brûlée. It was unbelievable. Best dessert ever! And the price wasn’t expensive. We had very mediocre dishes in Paris and we paid almost the same price. I strongly recommend this restaurant.

review_data.review_title: Not that this restaurant needs another 5* review...
review_data.review: ...but I'll add to it anyway!  My friend surprised me with a visit here for my birthday, me a vegetarian and her very much a carnivore. The food is incredible! So many amazing flavours and the chef has clearly put a lot of thought into how the dishes all go together.  Not only is it delicious, but it is greatvalue for money. £20pp gets you the grande selection - a tapas-style offering of nearly everything on the menu. It's more food than we could eat (and boy did we try!). Favourite dishes included the cashew cheeze, the homemade pakoras and the two curry dishes.  You get free top ups of any dish you want (we couldn't manage that) and they give you doggy bags to take away your left overs. The vegan brownie we had for dessert was TO DIE FOR. Oh how can it be so rich and crispy and gooey all at once, and accompanied by delicious vegan ice cream.  You bring your own booze but we also tried the delicious complimentary tea at the end. They were also kind enough to give us little pots of the tea mix to try at home!  The atmosphere was warm and welcoming, with everyone cooing when their selections arrived, and the staff were incredibly lovely and helpful.  This is a gem in Earlsfield and I'll definitely be back, bringing friends (veggies and non-veggies alike) so that we can feast again!!

review_data.review: After a fair amount of stomping around the Old Town, some lunchtime food was necessary, so I followed Lonely Planet's suggestion of this place, for it's views as much as anything else.  It's just a few minutes walk away from the Basilica Cistern and the Hippodrome and accessed through the And Hotel lobby.  When I arrived, there was nobody else in the restaurant, so the service was rapid and attentive. However, the dish I picked from the menu was off and I was steered towards one of the specials instead.  When this arrived, it was fine - a lamb dish - but I didn't much like the bed of sauce and vegetables it was on - but this is probably my problem as I'm not a big fan of vegetables!  The cost was fair and the staff were lovely - but the real draw for this place is the excellent panoramic views it offers.

review_data.review_title: Great food, beautiful ambiance, exceptional service
review_data.review: We only stayed at La Siesta Trendy for two nights and on the first night in Vietnam we had to have the obligatory street food which was great. For the second night, and after a very long day of touring the city, we decided to have dinner at The Red Bean. Greeted by friendly staff at the lift door, we were ushered to an intimate table and offered a menu with a great selection of dishes and drinks including cocktails. For cocktails we had: The Naked Man Pina Colada Both very moorish, so we had seconds at the end of our meal! We would recommend the spring rolls platter which had two fresh rolls, two crispy seafood rolls and two crispy Hanoi pork rolls. This was followed by a beautifully presented steaming bowl of pho. The pho at the restaurant was a delicately flavoured broth with rice noodles and tender beef. It was different to the rustic flavours you’d get from street food vendors and equally as wonderful. Every pho recipe has some hidden secrets and this was evident in the subtlety different flavours. Mango sticky rice wrapped up the evening and the warm coconut flavoured rice with sweet mango was everything that I was expecting and looking forward to trying for the first time. It was a great restaurant choice for our last night in Hanoi and if we are ever here again we will definitely visit.

review_data.review_title: Great Argentine food at great prices
review_data.review: This place is the real deal: great genuine Argentine food, friendly service, nice ambience and very reasonable (non tourist) prices. I am an Argentine living in the U.S., so I know! We were in Buenos Aires for a week and despite the countless restaurants in the Palermo area, we just had to go back to this restaurant twice.  Try the classic "provoleta" as a starter. It is an Argentine staple, as is the chicken milanesa as a main course. For those who like something sweet and new, try their mashed sweet potatoes. They are not the same root vegetable as eaten in the U.S. It's sweeter and more fragrant. The dulce de leche pancakes for dessert are a great way to end a fabulous meal. I hope you enjoy it as much as we did!

review_data.review: What a fantastic restaurant, worthy of its place in the Michelin guide. Tucked away in the trendy Marais district of Paris, not too far from Notre Dame cathedral, surrounded by many independent shops and galleries, it is a small red fronted building which doesn’t look much from the outside. However, the food is nothing like the understated exterior. They offer either a 5 course tasting menu or a la Carter, and they seem to specialise in various types of caviar. The tasting menu was a real wow, specialising in classic French dishes with a a twist. Foie Gras with mussels, smoked potato with caviar, fresh pollock with cream sauce and fantastic duck with girolles and pumpkin. Dessert of pears with ginger was one of the best I’ve ever tasted. Service was impeccable - friendly, efficient and very knowledgable. If you in Paris, you should definitely make a trip to Boutary.

review_data.review_title: My first Inedible Michelin star restaurant
review_data.review: Let's face it and we knew it before booking: Czech cuisine is hadrly recognized as French,or italian cusines as some of the most universal best culinary experiences in the world.However, when i booked this one 6 months early, I was looking to experiment local Czech tradition food at an innovative and excellent level.The reviews seemed mostly positive and we were excited about it for the first of 3 nights in Prague. The first impression from the decor is clean and sort of lacking personality or local character: nothing fancy, for all you know, you could be in the lounge of a Hilton anyweher in the world. That's after the first nice course of our tasting menu was served that things quickly turned bad: from the aged "tartare" that tasted like old, dry chewing gum and looked more like rabbit poop to the tasteless spike trout or rubbery duck, even an applestrudel that was barely baked, no sugar, no crunch, no flavor...All of that was not at par with a Michelin star-even one-standard, service was ok albeit slow and sometimes inattentive although Libor tried his best...A $75 prix fixe in Prague would and should take you to an incredible level. anywhere else...but this one was one of the worst we experienced in the Czarch capital...even a little lunch at a street Chinese restaraurant the next day was flavorful, fresh and tasty for a mere $10 per person !!! I am not sure why this restaurant that seemes to be operated by Indian owners got to receive the Star or glowing social media reviews here...but I do know, as a French born -now American citizen living in the USA and having dined at more than 50 of the best Michelin star restaurants in the world- that this was one of the most disappointing, deplorable if not outrageous dining experience I ever had in the past 40 years...

review_data.review: We were visiting London for the weekend and wanted to have Lebanese. There aren’t any good Lebanese where we live. We had mixed trio of hummous. The best one was the beetroot one.  For mains we got Kafta Kashkash. We went weren’t sure what to expect. It was kebabs with a spicy tomato, onion sauce. I liked it as it make the kebabs easier to eat with the rice. It’s as a good meal. I should have forgone the starters and it was lovely.  The dessert wasn’t great. Over powered with rose water. We wrongly thought it would be similar to the Mahalabia in a Lebanese restaurant in Marrakech. That’s as divine and made with Orange water. So much nicer.  I recommend this restaurant. It’s easier to find from Chanery lane tube station rather than Holborn. We would have taken a taxi but there was queue and we would have been late.

review_data.review: We have literally traveled all over the world in the last couple of years and have had some of the most wonderful dining experiences ever-but NONE of them compare to the wonderful evening we just had hosted by Luis! Asado-the Argentinian custom of sharing good food and barbecued meats- a tradition that we now love! We also had never experienced a "Closed-Door dining experience" where the address of the restaurant is provided to you with your reservation confirmation and you arrive at the address, which is an unmarked door- you ring the bell- give your name- and you are granted entrance into a very special dinner! Luis explained everything we were going to eat... He told us about the 5 wines that would be paired with the 5 courses- he then showed us the FABULOUS pieces of Argentine beef-did I mention that we each got 32 ounces of this mouth watering steak? We had 12 people at our dinner. We were the only people who didn't speak Spanish-it didn't matter one bit! Luis told the two of us everything in English and the people we shared our meal with made us feel welcomed-we all laughed and talked for almost 4 hours! The food was incredible and the company was better! If you are in Buenos Aires, I highly recommend that you grab a reservation for this dinner so you can experience Luis's hospitality first hand!

review_data.review: We first visited this restaurant almost exactly a year ago and were astonished to find we were the only diners that night, because the quality and value proved to be so high. On 16th Feb this year we returned for a second visit and were met with the same high standards but this time there was barely a spare table to be had, fantastic. The staff coped really well with the level of demands placed upon them and if you understand that some of them were relatively inexperienced because of the basis on which the business operates then this was even more impressive. The lady manager for the night had only to keep a watching brief and scarcely intervene at all.  The food remains excellent - the fried beef with red ants is a must try. Coupled with great value for money and free pick up and drop off service it make it a first class choice. Don’t be put off by the fairly obscure location and the alleyways that the tuk tuk driver has to take to get you to the entrance, it is all worth it.

review_data.review: We dined here in the middle of February after attending the Sacred Dancers of Angkor performance on the other side of the river. We were the only diners which, when we had finished a quite superb meal, left me amazed at how this venue is not on everybody's radar.  Won't repeat the principles on which this restaurant runs - read it all on their website - but it is worth supporting on that basis alone. Add to this the fact that the food is of such high quality and the staff so keen to make sure you have an enjoyable meal it is a tragedy that the place is not heaving with people every night.  The menu is varied and offered our jaded western palettes the opportunity to try some really authentic local cuisine - I will never look at red ants the same way ! It is also super value for money.  So Mr Rotha, Miss Ling, Mr Orm and Mr Pist - keep up the good work for your bosses. Everybody else - just go there !

review_data.review: This is a unique restaurant for its truly outstanding food and the chef behind it all, a national celebrity who trains aspiring chef. He himself was trained in Siem Reap and uses his grandmother’s recipes to create delicious dishes based on tradicional Cambodian food fused with South East Asian stuff. A absolutely adore the grilled chicken with the sweet potato and coconut milk mash, and the grilled rice balls/dumplings with chive. There are a lot of dishes for the more adventurous palate also, using local herbs and roots. All very very delicious indeed and very reasonably priced. On this trip to Siem Reap I visited 4 times in one week.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: Its grilled chicken Khmer style with mashed sweet potato goes down as one of my top 10 meals. Its owner, one of Cambodia’s top chefs, tries to promote real countryside cuisine based on recipes which have been passed down through generations. The result is a creative display of interesting stuff and a delicious feast of flavours. It gets extremely busy at night so I preferred lunches. Prices are very reasonable. Not to be missed. Try some of the very creative cocktails created using tradicional Cambodian stuff like local Whisky and palm sugar.

One of my best meals ever and a wonderful discovery. Food is reasonably priced, and very very good. I would say Michelin-star quality: very innovative, wonderfully presented and just extremely tasty. I loved the spicy chicken wings in a delicious curry sauce and the Cambodian grilled chicken served with a fabulous sweet potato and coconut mash. Shall return tomorrow. The chef is well known in the local circle and is highly regarded. Is something who will be around for a long time creating wonderful dishes.

We went at lunch, experience is amazing. Very small and imtimate, tables are on top of each other, but that adds to the experience. Lunch is an incredible value, most of full menu options available for only $11, wow. The Sicilian Meatballs are amazing. Staff is all Sicilian, feel like you are there as they are all speaking native. If you want amazing hand made pasta, do go here, do not even think about showing up without a reservation. If you are looking for a quiet, say romantic setting this is not it. However the intimacy adds to the experience.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: This is an outstanding restaurant. I understand the high ratings over the years. The work coming from the kitchen are masterpieces. Chef does an amazing job of bringing flavors together. He is big on adding an orange tint to items, very different! They did nice presentation for my wife's birthday, this is appreciative. Also the service is outstanding, nothing spared yet is not over the top. Would highly recommend this establishment. Also $70 for 3 courses of this quality is very good compared to some other similar offerings in the city.

A very clean establishment training young boys and girls in the hospitality business. We read the brochure and appreciated the process more and we were more comfortable with a long wait but once the food came it was very well presented and tasty. We had this incorporated into our 7 day tour and it was a big draw card for choosing this type of tour. We had the set lunch menu and the fish which was goby madrone in an amok style was served with a refreshing salad. We had interesting drink shakes beforehand. The organiser of the school came for a showery chat with us which was pleasant and not pushy.

review_data.review_title: Shockingly impersonal hosts. Decent food, nothing really outstanding! Mediocre Wines.
review_data.review: We had an OK night at casa SaltShaker, but in the end it was a disappointmet, because we  expected MUCH more.  First of all, the food was ok - there's nothing to complain about. However, it wasn't anyting really special. This is definitely NOT world class, in a city famous for its abundance of world class restaurants. Of course, this insight was a disappointment!  The best way to describe what I mean is:  If I was invited to a hobby cook's house and he cooked such a meal, it would be great. If however somebody pretending to be a knowledgable chef invited me to his and cooked this menu for me, I would clearly think that he was not trying nearly as hard as he could, but was saving efforts...  The Casa Saltshaker guys are definitely to be attributed to the hobby cook area...the problem is that TA rates them in the other category (and they think that they belong there...)  The HUGE DISAPPOINTMENT was however was the complete abscence of any personal interaction on behalf of the "hosts". When you "invite" somebody into your home and you do not wish to exchange even a word with your "guests", this is really a bummer. I had the feeling that they were desperate to put us through the process as quickly as possible, collect our money and send us home.  I certainly didn't feel welcome there.  Exemplatory for the attitude towards their guest was this episode:  Coming in I was thirsty and aksed for a glass of water. They rejected it by saying that they would start serving dinner in 10min. REALLY!? Is THAT hospitality?! No one had ever before denied me a glass of water :-)  Making up for the desaster that our hosts were was a quite nice mix of guests with whom we've had a fun evening anyway, despite the hosts (unfortunately not because of them :-)  Last but not least, the wine "pairing" we had with the meal was mediocre. We have had wine pairings in good places in Buenos Aires, so we know what can be expected in this price range. The guys either don't have a clue about wine or they simply don't care (I suppose it's the latter, because it fits the overall picture).

review_data.review_title: An up market Italian/ Morrocan fusion restaurant set within a beautifully decorated riad building.
review_data.review: We chose this restaurant for our last night in Marrakesh. We followed the signs from the main street Rue Zitoun Kedim and went through an area where local youngsters were hanging out and playing football and we thought we were lost. We then spotted a sign for the restaurant again and a member of the staff, dressed in a hooded cloak escorted us to PepeNero. We hadn't booked in advance, but after a few minutes, a lovely table was found for us, right opposite the ornamental pool shown on the photo in the restaurants' Tripadvisor profile. We were looked after by Mr Khalid and the service was quite formal but very professional and friendly. We had a lovely meal and enjoyed the evening. It was the most expensive meal we had during the week, but we would definitely return and recommend to others. Just to mention, that when we left the restaurant, those same youngsters approached us and insisted that the route we were taking was closed off (despite people coming from that direction) and they would show us an alternative route. Fortunately we had Google maps open so we could see they were taking us completely the wrong way. We were warned that this could happen so we were prepared. Would advise planning your return route before leaving or asking the staff for directions back to your accommodation.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: You need to book this restaurant as it is full every evening. So glad we did as it was a real treat! From the outside you wouldn't know it is a restaurant as there are no signs just a large letter B. Once inside there is a dark and cosy bar preparing a large selection of cocktails. We were greeted by a friendly member of staff who showed us to our table. Restaurant wasn't full when we arrived but soon all tables were gone. Food was amazing!! I had lamb while my boyfriend opted for beef both were equally as nice as the other. The only criticism I would have is that there was no veg with my lamb and there wasn't the option to order any. Dessert were yummy too. Cocktails and wine what more could you want. Staff were very attentive and made our experience a special one..

review_data.review: I travelled to London from little village oooop nooorf called Manchester to attend a reunion in Mayfair and took the opportunity to meet up with my daughter who is currently living in London for dinner so wanted a quality restaurant but nothing stuffy.  I was checking out various venues and as it was going to be an early evening meeting I spotted that there was an excellent set menu offering at Theos so I immediately made an online booking to secure a table as it was for a Saturday -success, however, heads up, there's a booking system glitch!  On the evening there was confusion with the staff regarding the menu, initially we were given a la carte menus despite the booking stating it was for the set menu.  In the end is was sorted, to a degree, as we were presented with a set menu option, but, not the one I had booked which included half a bottle of wine per person, apparently that one was not recognised and ours only included a glass of prosecco each! I decided not to make a fuss but clearly I was not happy especially for this mix up to happen in such a reputable hotel/restaurant*  Upon returning home I contacted the restaurant and Pawel was very apologetic and acknowledged that there was a glitch on the booking system and that he would make amends for our next visit......  Anyway, back to to the food -it was all very good and the staff were attentive but needless to say the experience was tempered due to the menu saga along with having to pay an extra £40 (unnecessarily) for wine so I shall reserve final judgement and do a more detailed report when we have our return visit.  *I first frequented the London Intercon about 40 years ago.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: This review is for my second return visit in January but TripAdvisor does not allow subsequent reviews until at least a month has passed which is a shame as I wanted this to go live immediatlely after our visit.  Background: although our previous visit was marred by a menu/billing mix up the food was clearly very good so I wanted to return to experience it to the full and with that in mind I contacted the restaurant to give them my direct feedback. Pawel acknowledged my complaint and was genuinely apologetic and confirmed that he would make amends on our next visit. As it happens I'm not in London that frequently but circumstances necessitated that I was there a few weeks later and therefore made a much anticipated booking.  In a nutshell, it was a top notch experience -Katie our waitress looked after us like we were VIP guests and it was nice to meet Pawel who gave us a warm welcome and also saw us to our table and last but not least Vanessa the Manageress who came over to say "hello". Vanessa was very personable and it was really enjoyable to chat with her.  The whole meal was excellent, my favourite is the slow cooked beef ragu in Chianti -a must try dish!  Sadly I have no immediate plans to return to London but Theo Randall will be on my to do list when I am next in town.....

I had a tremendous great experience of the fresh beef tartare there on my last visit. In fact it was so delicious that I will return again today.... Also their Signature dishes are stunning. Their steaks are definitely the best ones in Phuket at a great value deal with stunning high consistency! Friendly staff, clean and modern facilities.

We would have liked to check out the bar too but did not manage to do that on this occasion. I think, when we dined here previously (many years ago) that we had our meal on the upper level where the bar now is. I was keen to try some cocktails and was told that not all cocktails made in the bar were available in the restaurant and I wasn't sure why but that's ok. I did have 2 very nice cocktails whilst there (pink diamond and a dessert cocktail as I had no room for dessert after the amazing entree and main). Both myself and my husband had the Paua entree which was sublime and we then had mains as follows: Hubby had the beef which was divine and I had the duck which was exquisite. I can't recall the exact side dishes we had but we had 2 and they complemented our mains beautifully. Dar Moha is simply beautiful. If the setting wasn't enough, the food is outstanding. We had the 14 light salads (pre-starter) which were delicious! There is almost too much food to try but all dishes were delicious. I then opted for the sea bass tagine which was a delight, and then the sorbet dessert. The wine was also exquisite. The ambience was helped by a sitar player in the far corner of the restaurant, and later followed by a pair of traditional Moroccan musicians. The restaurant is beautiful; the staff attentive and helpful. Would recommend everyone visits Dar Moha when in Marrakech. It's an absolute treat.

review_data.review_title: Utterly romantic Italian restaurant in the heart of the medina
review_data.review: This is a stunning and very romantic restaurant housed within a jewel-like riad which is tucked away down a narrow alleyway in the heart of the medina. Tables are situated around a pool and a central marble courtyard with a mosaic clad fountain. A large speaker provides some cool background beats. The restaurant offers two menus – Moroccan and Italian – with the ability to mix and match both. The latter offered a welcome break from the traditional tagines. The king prawns with diced tomatoes and cocktail sauce and the eggplant mozzarella for starters were both beautifully seasoned and bursting with flavour and the home made fettucine and tortellini parmesan cream for main brought back fond memories of some of the best Italian pasta houses. There is an extensive wine list although the Moroccan wine is slightly on the expensive side. The only downside was the service which can best be described as unfriendly and unengaging and we felt a little rushed with courses arriving quickly when we had indicated we would like a break or, in the case of the bill, unprompted. It was slightly odd to be taken to a back room to pay the bill by credit card but I had nothing to fear in that all of the staff were extremely courteous and polite. This was our stand out favourite restaurant during our nine night stay in Marrakesh and we cannot wait to return.  Tip: Ignore the young men waiting to greet you when you leave the restaurant who will seek to persuade you to follow them on a different route back to the main square on the basis that the conventional route is closed at night. This is a standard ruse at this (and many other) locations and an attempt to fleece you of your hard earned dirhams……

We went for the full 8 courses, we arrived on time and were offered either to sit at the bar or to head to the table and start. This was a great way to start the meal as it set the scene for it being about us and not rushed.  The waiter loves his job and was excellent at explaining each dish and all of the components.  Each dish appeared to one up the one before all with great balance and flair.  The non-alcoholic drinks menu is good and they are happy to make up a mocktail to your taste on the night  Overall a great atmosphere with awesome food and great service

I highly recommend this place for a warm, home like experience and above all, the best, great Indian food in London.

review_data.review_title: Very good, a bit expensive though...
review_data.review: Fresh pasta always draws us in and Oliva Nera did a good job of it!  We started with the bruschetta, great focaccia and garlic flavor...then had the carbonara and the spaghetti with frutta di mare. Both were served steaming hot and were flavorful. The crispy guanciale lent a nice smoky element to the carbonara. The frutta di mare was good too but the shrimp were very small and probably were a frozen component.  Finished with a pistachio semifreddo, which was very good!  The service by Marcela was excellen  The total, including 2 bottles of water, 3 glasses of wine, a cappuccino and a 15% tip, came to 2600 Ckn or about US$110.00, a bit on the expensive side, but very good.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review_title: Very nice atmosphere but possibly overrated...
review_data.review: Great ambiance in a small place, reservations are required as they only have 12 seats. They offer 2 hour seatings beginning at 5 pm and it was full. They should put a sign on the door saying full as the staff had to constantly turn away people.  Quite a few small plates to choose from with an ample list of wines to pair with them.  We had the garlic shrimp, Italian meatballs, salmon in crispy Philo and the potatoes with bacon and cheese. Good flavors, but shrimp and salmon were way over cooked, shrimp could have been a frozen product.  The place feels like a small gathering of friends for wine and appetizers so it's a great concept and the personal service is very good, but our food experience led us to feel that it is possibly overrated.

Wonderful dinner here tonight, started with thd tomato and portobello salad and the tandoori tiger shrimp, both were creatively flavored and just the right size portions.  Then had the glazed perch and the chicken tikki masala...presented very well and great flavors as well. The perch flaked perfectly, accompanied by grilled cauliflower and a leek slaw. Delicious! My wife's chicken was tender and nicely spiced, served with lentils and basmati rice.  Finished with a portion of warm apple strudel ice cream.  Had a nice rosé and made for a perfect dinner! Not cheap at 3500 CzK but we thoroughly enjoyed our dinner.
We were well satisfied with our burgers and the staff was also pleasant and helpful - not always a given in Prague.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: for starters i ordered papari chaat and for main I ordered two curries, Mutton Karahi and chicken hyderabadi. The papri chaat was faultless and tasty, however the two curries were both disappointing, the mutton karahi was dry and the pieces of meat were big. The chicken hyderabadi meat contained the same pieces of meat, it was not the proper chicken breast succulent pieces. I also ended up with an upset stomach the day after. I will not be visiting this place and would recommend you look for an alternative indian restaurant.

review_data.review_title: Excellent food, service and atmosphere: Tapas French style
review_data.review: This casual restaurant serves a limited, check off menu that includes everything from meat lovers to vegetarians. We were a group of four, and we tried just about every item offered. The flavor of every plate was stupendous! The owners and severs, Roland, Thibault, and Gautier were busy, yet at the same time were very attentive, and made sure you were satisfied. They were very personable and you got a strong feeling that they enjoyed their work. The menu is priced reasonably. Be sure to make a reservation for this fabulous establishment.

review_data.review: We visited the Clay for dinner. It was amazing - forget Nobu, this is the real thing. Perfect presentation of amazing food. The drinks are perfect and we did love them. The service, our server was Florin, was the best server we had in Dubai during our stay.  The food, ceviche, sushi, sashimi and the specialities were more than amazing. We just decoded for the starter, also after a quick consultation with Frorin, and we need to come back and get the main courses.  It’s a must visit in Dubai for amazing service and food - compliment.

review_data.review: Housed in the swanky Park Hyatt Vendome, this restaurant is on the lobby level. They have 3 choices for dinner - 2 degustations and a la carte. I opted for the 6 course degustation. 3 amuse bousche came first and they were ok. The 1st course was white asparagus. Not a big fan, but it was ok. Seabass followed and it was good and well coordinated with all the other elements. Veal was the main and it was very good. A heavy melted cheese course followed. It was ok but too heavy and cheesy to finish. The strawberry and chocolate desserts finished the set and they were great. Petit fours were also too much for me by then  Service is very good as expected  Pur-fect

review_data.review: The steak and bbq restaurant for W hotels worldwide. Good quality with the great W service and friendliness

This is one of the restaurants at intercontinental park lane where i stayed and apparently from a celebrity chef. Came here for breakfast and it’s nice to be in a fancy restaurant rather than one of those mass market places. Very good quality and service

Couldn't get a reservation at Epicure , Le Bristol and they counter offered a seat at this restaurant, which i took  This restaurant is quite casual so i thought the hotel guests have breakfast here but this is not the case. Evidently not an "IT" restaurant in paris. I was here 7 -830pm on a friday night and the place was only 20% full. I also felt overdressed wearing a suit with bow tie  Had the award winning duck pate and it was good. The pigeon was commendable too, and traditionally presented. I prefer the pigeon i had at Le Mesure a few days ago  Service was good but i had such a great time with the staff at Le Gabriel earlier during lunch this pales slightly

As per previous reviewer, it’s under renovation, but we had their menu and food in the all day restaurant  We had a large variety of dishes over 2 days - steamed fish with lime, satay, beef and vegetable curry were good. Duck curry was odd as the duck was like tempura. Crab omelette was equally off with the crab like tempura too. the red ruby dessert also tasted different, not sure good or bad

Thank you TA, I read the reviews and we visited a couple of days ago... the 95dh menu was amazing value, I had the pastille which was so tasty, followed by the kofta tagine, which was just right, my husband had the chicken couscous which was huge.... all nicely served and piping hot. The staff were attentive and friendly and we sat outside for a great atmosphere... even the tiny WC was clean and fresh smelling, not always the case in Morocco!  I would not hesitate to recommend this restaurant and will visit again...

review_data.review_title: Top flight Korean with that Michelin flair
review_data.review: The food was phenomenal, and the service was excellent. Some of the descriptions of the food, spices, and inspirations for the dishes were a little unfamiliar coming from a Korean influence, but the food definitely gives a sense of place. Each dish was flawless, although the Mackerel dish was a little too fishy for our taste. (Our mistake for never having had Mackerel before.) The Octopus was delicious; tender and perfect. The Bossam (pork belly rice) was beautifully porky without being greasy. The Sea Bream was delicate and flavorful. I would recommend the Galbi (pork ribs), but you can also have them on W 32nd probably just as good but not on such a pretty plate. The desserts were works of art that were as tasty as they were beautiful. The Jang Dok were little kimchi pots made of ganache which was a nice way for the chef to tell his story. Likewise for the Harubang, by far the prettiest plate. I wish there was a little bit more light so we could have enjoyed the beauty of these plates. Wine list is excellent. The service was spot-on and polished, although a little reserved. We were able to warm up our servers a little by asking some questions and they showed some personality.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review_title: Amazing tasting menu with wine pairings in the perfect setting!
review_data.review: Just enjoyed dinner at Casa Coupage last night. The tasting menu and wine pairings were fantastic. Dinner was served by a lovely waitress and all of our pairings were put together by Santiago, one of the owners and a sommelier. The "closed door" restaurant was in an unmarked house in Palermo, very charming. We selected the tasting menu ($350 pesos per person) and did 5 wine pairings. At the end we ended up receiving a total of 7 wines including a sparkling wine upon arrival and an extra white from Santiago. The pours were huge and I would highly reconmend doing the pairing (an extra $170 pesos) Dinner was wonderful but be warned we were there for 4.5 hours! You almost needed that much time to drink as much wine as we did! We also got totally wrapped up in a game of "guess the essence from the sommelier kit" with Santiago. Even still I wouldn't plan on leaving in much under 4 hours. We were there with friends so it was a great time and the food was fantastic. A very special dinner in BA.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review_title: Outstanding Italian and Moroccan courtyard restaurant
review_data.review: This restaurant is part of the Riyad al Moussika. It's in the original courtyard of the Riyad and offers both traditional Moroccan and Italian food as the Riyad is owned by an Italian family. You can mix and match courses from both menus as I did. The vegetables are grown on the family's own land outside of Marrakech and are delicious. The restaurant is not that easy to find as its down a tiny back street but it it signposted from the square. The courtyard is beautifully elegant with a lovely water feature. Food and service were outstanding and they serve alcohol even in Ramadam. The restaurant is run by the same efficient,friendly guy who is the senior manager of the Riyad. We were staying at Al Moussika so saved this restaurant for our last night and we weren't disappointed. Some reviews said it was priced but we didn't think it was bearing in mind the far superior quality of food and drink on offer. I had aubergine parmegiana to start and then shared theslow cooked lamb with my husband - delicious. I would 100% recommend this restaurant.

It is very noisy, but mostly from people talking and having a good time. Spontaneous dancing broke during our meal - just like dining in a local resto in southern Italy.

review_data.review: The cocktails at Wild are really fab. They don’t do dinner as such but have many different types of spring rolls. So, it’s like tapas. We ordered 5 lots of different spring rolls between the 2 of us and found that to be enough for dinner. We also tried 3 different cocktails, all of which were good. The garden setting is really lovely and I can’t wait to visit again.

review_data.review_title: Mostly good but room for improvement
review_data.review: I visited twice in December, once by myself for lunch and again for lunch with hubby.  The first time I visited I had to go to the counter to ask for a menu. I sat down thinking they would bring a menu but I changed tables as I was too hot where I originally sat down. I wasn’t brought a menu at either table so I thought they didn’t have table service and you had to order at the counter by the cakes. When I asked if I could see their lunch menu they said they’d bring it over. Perhaps they didn’t see me come in but my first impression wasn’t that good. I know it’s not a big thing but nevertheless it’s nice to be greeted and brought a menu within the first few mins of entering a cafe/restaurant. Perhaps it would be better just to leave the menus on the table.  On my first visit they had run out of the vegan quiche. I understand cafes run out of food but it was a little bit disappointing since it was only around 1pm which is peak lunch time. Luckily, I’m not vegan I just like to eat vegan sometimes but from memory there weren’t that many other vegan choices so this may be a problem for others.  On my 2nd visit I was able to order the vegan quiche and my husband ordered a veggie one. Unfortunately, the vegan quiche had mustard seed and I’m allergic to mustard so I had to swap with my husband. It wasn’t written on the menu so I didn’t know before ordering. It would be nice if this info was added to the menu. I took one bite before I realized. The vegan quiche was not as tasty as the veggie quiche which contains dairy so perhaps a little tweak of the recipe might be in order.  We ordered 2 coconuts and one was nice and chilled and the other one completely warm.  On the 2nd visit we were brought menus straight away but our waitress silently took our order and also didn’t say anything when she brought our bill which my husband commented on. He thought perhaps she didn’t speak English. My husband is a local so she could have used Khmer if she preferred.  I understand this is a training school cafe so I’m writing this as constructive feedback so that others can have a more seamless experience.  The points above wouldn’t stop me from visiting again but there’s room for improvement.

review_data.review_title: Not many choices for lunch but the choices they do have are tasty
review_data.review: The only choices for the mains is cold pasta. I wasn’t sure what I’d think of the mango pasta but it wasn’t too sweet and great as a main dish.

review_data.review_title: Business lunch menu is superb value for money
review_data.review: I visited Chi restaurant with my cousin and his wife for lunch. We ordered from the business lunch menu. It is extremely good value for money considering the quality of food, ambience and service.  You can get 2 courses for $12 or 3 courses for $15 including one glass of wine or a soft drink. I found out about the business lunch menu from other TA reviews.  Unfortunately, we couldn’t afford to visit Chi restaurant for tasting menus that they offer in the evening but this was perfect.  The manager Sarah even came to introduce herself during our meal.  I would definitely like to visit again with hubby.

review_data.review_title: Smooth service for the most part
review_data.review: Sala Bai is a training school so sometimes there can be a few problems. We had a problem with one of our dishes but otherwise the meal itself and the service was very good. The duty manager came to speak to us at the end of our meal to check our dining experience which I appreciated. Eating at the training restaurant allows them to continue training students and I would definitely eat there again.

Hubby and I decided to try this new cafe since I noticed it was getting a lot of good reviews. The service was good without being overbearing and the staff checked with us if the food was ok.  They have a good selection of Khmer and Western food as well as juices and coffees. 2 mains and a green juice set us back $11.50 which I think was reasonable given the portion size and quality of the food. I would like to visit again, it’s just a shame it’s not open later on in the evening.

My husband and I had dinner here 2 nights ago. The ambience and presentation of the food was nice but the colourful sauces were more for decorative purposes than for taste which was a shame. Maybe it just wasn't to our taste.  The chive dumpling dish was better but the sauce for the veggies was so spicy it was a struggle to finish the dish.

review_data.review_title: Need to bring ID if not staying at the hostel
review_data.review: We visited last Friday evening.  The night didn't start off well as the security guard watching the motorbikes told us we couldn't come in because my husband is Khmer.  I started to feel my blood boil but luckily another staff member came and said we could come in but we had to go talk to reception (we weren't planning on staying, we just wanted dinner and a drink)  At reception, a lady who was a bit more knowledgeable than the security guard explained that since you have to walk past all the hostel rooms (3 floors) to get to the Sky bar where the bar/restaurant is, they need to take a copy of ID cards for Khmers and a copy of the photo page in the passport for non-Khmers to know who is coming and going for the safety and security of the guests at the hostel.  Once this was explained properly in a polite manner it was not a problem. I still find it a bit strange though as I normally don't carry around my passport when going out for dinner but luckily hubby had his ID card which meant that he became a member and could bring in a guest, me. So, it all worked out ok in the end. It's just a shame that the new security guard (we were told he was new by the other member of staff) is turning locals away.  As with most things here, it is an easily solvable problem. I don't know why they can't put up a big poster saying "ID card (for Cambodians) or passport (for non-Cambodians) needed to enter the premises for the safety and security of guests and visitors. We appreciate your co-operation."  After all, they had a poster saying their restaurant was closed but still welcome to order food at the bar, so they are capable of making and putting up signs.  The food was surprisingly good for a hostel. It was No.1 on TripAdvisor about a month ago and I was curious about it so suggested to my husband that we go.  Luckily, the nice female member of staff (didn't catch her name) and the good food managed to turn the evening around but just be forewarned that if you're not a guest you'll need ID to be able to go into the bar/restaurant area.

review_data.review_title: Tasty new Indian restaurant in town
review_data.review: I decided to visit based on the other positive reviews and to check out the new Indian restaurant in town. I am a big fan of paneer dishes. I ordered the paneer tikka masala which was delicious and they were generous with the paneer which I appreciated. The mango lassi was also very tasty. Pricing is similar to other Indian restaurants in town but I would say Rasoi Ghar is one of the better Indian restaurants that I’ve tried in Siem Reap and I’ve tried a fair few.

The Bunker Restaurant is set in moody dark space. The welcoming smile from Emma was lovely on arrival as was the cocktail bar service from Claudio which was warm and jovial followed by waiting service from Emma, Penny and Adam with professionalism and a smile. Thanks also to the kitchen crew who made the delicious degustation dinner.

review_data.review: As part of my stay we had breakfast included, the offerings were excellent covering all tastes, the food fresh and the service excellent.

We came in family (2 adults and 2 boys) and this restaurant is really our favorite. A small restaurant so charming, the boss is so lovely, and the quality of the food is "exceptional". A perfect balance of flavors and spices (I took the curry Massamane and my wife the vegetarian rice in a half pineapple ... we touched the paradise !). And the fresh juice for kids were so good ... all this quality for modest prices. SAMBO Khmer & Thai restaurant is an essential restaurant in Siem Reap, just go and test ! Be careful when you try to find the restaurant with PassApp application there is another Sambo restaurant that not exist. The good adress is just close to the night market.

In Lotte Saigon, they juice vegetables and fruits upon your request but I don't see it here, though. Eventhough fruits are available and juices were all displayed on the counter. The view from this restaurant is fantastic. Nothing beats a 63 floor view!

review_data.review: Quick. Range of fillings. The tacos are made in corn tortillas and are not stodgy. Price wise - around $8 a taco with a saving of around $1 per additional taco that you order. Service was fast, friendly and efficient. Once the tacos arrived there was a choice of three sauces - the hot one was reasonably spicy, which is unusual for NZ. Highly recommend it.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: Wide range of drinks and food including cocktails on the menu. Of note was the lemon, ginger honey tea which was very refreshing - not from a bag!  The food menu has a range of specials ( including blue cod) alongside the usual suspects - curries and noodle dishes. The service was very proficient with each member of staff having a specific role. The food did not take very long at all. Portion wise - satay chicken was 4 skewers and the mini vegetable rolls and tempura was more than enough for two. The mains were a reasonable size and are good value for money. My partner had his usual of yellow curry and you could taste the base ingredients and there were chillies in it, not a common sight in NZ. Both dishes had a good tingle to them and you don't have to ask for a spice level, instead cooked to the level as per the dish.  We didn't book and got a table immediately. They also do take away and have a special $10 menu.  Overall, tasty, good menu and excellent staff.

review_data.review_title: Top spot. Pay for the cab from town
review_data.review: Wonderful! We picked this on the basis that it was near the 02 so we could eat before a concert.  Frankly, it is worth going out by tube or even by cab just eat that. Very much a hidden gem as you are not likely to walk past it. Make sure you reserve and go a little hungry the food is fantastic, the service wonderful together with Marina definitely in the top two places we tried while in Prague. Totally totally good.  Perhaps $100 for two even after you have plenty of Prosecco and three courses. Extremely good value for money if you come from the rest of continental Europe.

review_data.review_title: Raise a Glass to the Rajdoot!
review_data.review: We enjoyed our final meal of the holiday here at Rajdoot and were a little apprehensive as all meals so far over the weekend had been very good. I suppose we were just thinking that law of averages would mean at least one poor meal? How wrong we were as we enjoyed probably the best evening of our family break. From the moment we exited the taxi outside the staff were out to greet us, very friendly and made us all feel welcome. You can tell that they all care about their business as they couldn’t do enough for us and even offered us complimentary drinks at the end of the meal. There were all the traditional offerings and some nice specialities too. We had Jalfrezi , chicken saag, and a king prawn korma and I liked the option to have your chicken grilled / tandoori as a opposed to plain. Of course we had poppodums and chutney to start, who doesn’t? All washed down with ice cold Cobra beer. I think everyone was slightly jealous of my wife’s Chicken Saag, not only was it delicious but it came in the hit sizzling pot, which I always feels adds to the experience and I’d encourage them to serve the jalfrezi this way! I’m not sure if this is practical but it certainly makes the table go “ooooh” as the sizzling dish approaches. I also liked the fact that when I asked fir my naan bread well done it came nice and crispy just as ordered. Seating was covid friendly and waiters wore face masks so no issues with hygiene/ CV19 To finish off our fabulous evening the waiter allowed my son in law to take away his beautiful cobra glass that he’d been eyeing all evening, which I felt was a lovely touch and made Toms night! Thanks to all the staff at the Rajdoot and I would encourage you to try this place whilst in London. Highly recommended

review_data.review_title: Great for both meat eaters and veggies

I had a Kadhai Paneer curry and my wife had a chicken curry. We both really enjoyed the food and atmosphere. The staff were friendly and could speak English. Would definitely go back.

It was quite hard to cut but tasted so good with the amazing blue cheese sauce. Finished with a dessert of fudge and ice cream which was a huge and delicious portion. Was impressed and the bill was very reasonable for a steakhouse. Service was reasonable. Small restaurant adjoined to a hotel.

review_data.review_title: MY CHOICE FOR ONE OF THE BEST IN BUENOS AIRES
review_data.review: I am a steak lover and one of my reasons for the trip was to try the Argentine beef. First, the beef is equal to Morton's, Fleming's, Ruth's Cris etc. You just get twice as much for a little less money (at the NAME restaurants). Not being a late night eater I choose lunch. I tried Don Julio, Calden and on a lesser known note Clarkes. All the steaks were fantastic. Ribeye, Lomo, Entrana. Clarkes was cheaper, Calden more warm and welcoming (thanks to Christian) and a fantastic pour of Vino Tinto. We shared the stuffed mushrooms, my wife loved the ravioli and my steak was perfect! Calden is my repeat choice.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: We just finished a sumptuous dinner at this venue, and I felt like I had to share how outstanding the food and quality of service was.  We started the evening with their Brie Melters, which are pieces of Brie cheese deep-fried in a homemade batter. We paired the appetizer with a glass of Prosecco, currently on promotion.  Following this, we ordered the Lamb Stew and the Spaghetti Deluxe, in a rich red wine sauce. Sensational!  All-in-all, the quality of the ingredients, combined with the skilled knowledge of the kitchen brigade and the professionalism of the staff made this evening way more special than it should have been.  Highly recommended if you are in Kathu, or in Phuket Town.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: We visited Thong Dee this Sunday as the missus was craving for their Sunday Roast. The servings were exceptional, offering several options such as beef, lamb, chicken, etc.  I myself enjoyed a Brie Melter for the appetizer, followed by their gourmet Pad Kaprao, which was perfect!  The staff and the owners were all very welcoming and easy to talk to. This is a must-visit restaurant if you are in or around Kathu.

During our holidays in Phuket we were staying at Baan Laimai Beach Resort in Patong and this restaurant is located in the hotel premises. This place has comfortable seating options on the lower and upper floors. We liked the decor and ambience was very nice. We had ordered Phuket style yellow sea food noodles and vodka & mango juice based cocktail drink. Quality of food was delicious and total bill was 570 baht.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review_title: Trendy French Restaurant on the Upper West Side
review_data.review: Great French restaurant on the UWS. Great food, great service and a great atmosphere. Comprehensive menu and wine list. We sat at the bar where we could chat with the (knowledgable) barman, who makes a mean Negroni. Enjoyed a spicy steak tartare followed by the skate which was divine. Can't recommend it too highly!!

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: We had an excellent dinner at this restaurant. Blair (Phuc) and Nat were extremely helpful and friendly. Blair gave excellent recommendations for our order. We had Aubergine in clay pot which was a curry with steamed rice. We also had curry vegetable with steamed rice. Both the main course dishes were tasty, flavourful and served in an attractive clay pot. For dessert we had passion fruit ice cream which was an excellent presentation in a scooped out passion fruit. Taste too was good. We also had creme brulee which was made perfectly. An excellent meal with great ambience. Will surely recommend visiting this restaurant.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: We had passion fruit Margherita which was very good. We being vegetarian were given great options by Noah the server. Ate vietnamese rolls, veg curry with rice from chef recommended menu and bok choy with mushroom. All the veg dishes were delicious. Finally we ended the meal with Vietnamese coffee with coconut which was really good. Overall an excellent meal and would surely recommend vegetarians to visit this place.

Had lovely Margheritas and tap beer. Long the server spoke excellent English and was a great host. Awesome view of Hanoi and great vibe. Do visit during happy hours (2+1). Will surely go again on my next trip to Hanoi.
The restaurant is on the top floor, incredible 360 view on old town, Bosphore and suburbs! The food was also excellent! 2 minutes from ayasofia! Very nice adress’

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: I love Mexican food so a quick search while in new York and Los tacos pops up so thought we'd give it a go. The menu is short and to the point and the service is fast, it's a bit like street food but served inside. As for the food they are really good taco's and reasonably priced, I say reasonably because unlike the rest of the places we ate in NY the portion sizes are normal, so you're more than likely going to want to order 2 or 3 dishes if you're after a meal.  Great place to stop buy for something quick and tasty, done expect to spend more than 15-30 mins in here!

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: We stumbled across his restaurant by chance at lunchtime. They were busy so we joined the small queue and waited for 15 minutes. They gave us a glass of complementary fruit juice as we waited which was lovely. In summary this place is excellent! The staff were very friendly and efficient. The food was really excellent, tasty, hot and inexpensive. I recommend trying the specialty dishes, ours were great. We hope to go again tomorrow. Try it, you won’t be disappointed. Thank you to the team that work there Chapeau!

review_data.review: We had a conference coming in Prague last week and I arranged for a group of 11 of us to have dinner at Grand Cru. They were wonderful to work with and very accommodating of any dietary restrictions. They provided a pre-fix 4 course menu, but I was able to give everyone a choice of entree so long as we let the kitchen know our selections within a few days notice. We did the wine pairing with dinner and it was superb. Everyone absolutely loved their dinner and I highly recommend. Thank you to Kristyna for helping coordinate the details and to everyone else for a wonderful evening!

review_data.review_title: Surprisingly Good Food, Great View & Fantastic Service
review_data.review: A lot of places in Thailand look good and have a nice view. Few though have great food at a reasonable price as well.  Rawai View Cafe oozes character; it's just a beautiful looking place that fits in nicely with its surroundings.  The staff are very friendly, the food comes out quick and the view just makes it an enjoyable place to be.  What was surprising though was the quality of the food and the presentation of it. Yes good food is not uncommon in Thailand but Rawai View Cafe's food is that little bit better.  We had spicy beef salad, garlic fried snapper and penang beef curry, and mango shakes - all delicious.  Tie that together with the presentation of the food, the service, the view, cheap prices and a nice place and they have a great all-round restaurant they can be proud of. There's free WiFi also!  If you're looking for a restaurant that ticks all the boxes for food, service, value and experience, this is it.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: I never would have picked this place on my own, so I'm glad I was part of a party who's guest of honor wanted to go. Fantastic dinner, melt in our mouth steak, great sides, great sized portions, service was excellent. Can't wait to go back.

user_data.user_tags: Art and Architecture Lover;Foodie;Like a Local;Luxury Traveler

review_data.review: Ate here three times during our stay. Food was excellent, and the portions large ( Be careful how much you order ). Service was efficient and friendly, there was a mix up with our desserts, due to me changing my mind, but was resolved quickly with no fuss. Prices are very reasonable, set 3 course menu 90 Dr. We had 2 set meals, and drinks for about 300 Dr. ( About £24 ). For very good reasons, it is a very popular restaurant, so be sure to book. No reservations for lunchtime, you just have to be lucky. Hope you like pink!

review_data.review: Tucked inside Blue Karma's Nestling Hotel you might miss this if you didn't know it was here. It has a large menu with a huge variety of food. My husband loved the Nasi Goreng and I fell in love with the chickpea and feta burger. The staff are attentive and always available
